item.title: GTA Online: How To Start/Unlock Terrorbyte Client Jobs
item.description:
When it comes to managing businesses in Grand Theft Auto Online , nothing annoys players more than traveling back and forth to their base of operations and interacting with the dedicated laptop to buy supplies, sell stock, and upgrade the facilities. The good news is that there's indeed a workaround to cut off these travels, and it also comes with lots of side benefits.

Terrorbyte is the solution to this problem. But it's more than just a mobile base for running businesses. It actually features a gameplay loop of its own that comes with unique missions and jobs, which are the main focus here, especially when there is a weekly bonus for completing Terrorbyte Client Jobs.

How To Get Terrorbyte

Terrorbyte is a high-end truck that comes with a cutting-edge base of operations inside its trailer, and it can be purchased from the Warstock Cache & Carry website online.

That being said, having the money to pay for it doesn't mean you can own it. Terrorbyte is only available to players who own a nightclub or the Garment Factory , because this giant truck only fits inside a nightclub basement or the Garment Factory garage. And the former is cheaper, but the latter comes with some unique upgrades to the vehicle.

So, once you purchase a nightclub from Maze Bank Foreclosures, head back to Warstock Cache & Carry, and the Terrorbyte will now be available for purchase. When it comes to the initial upgrades, you don't really need any of them for completing Client Jobs, but having a Specialized Workshop is recommended if you already own an Oppressor MK2 or are planning to get one soon.

After purchasing the Terrorbyte, head to your nightclub's garage, and there you will find the truck. Nightclub's garage offers some more upgrades to the truck, like better armor levels, but further upgrades will be available through the Garment Factory's garage.

Terrorbyte Client Jobs Missions

Take your Terrorbyte out of the garage and then park it somewhere safe. Now, stand next to the blue circle behind the trailer to enter the operation room. There is a big blue monitor inside . Interact with it, and you will see Client Jobs as an option.

There are six different jobs available, and players can complete them for unlimited times, though there will be cooldowns in between. Keep in mind that only the first four jobs can be done solo.

  • Robbery In Progress (Solo)
    • Check out the city cameras for all the banks and find the bank that is being robbed. Now, head to the location and rob the robbers, then deliver the money to finish the mission.

  • Data Sweep (Solo)
    • The game will locate multiple vehicles on the map as potential targets. The player must drive close to them and hack the car's data. Once the real target is revealed, kill its driver, steal the car, and deliver it to a set location.

  • Targeted Data (Solo)
    • Head inside a tech building, deal with the guards, and hack two computers that will reveal the target's location. Now, kill the target, and the mission is over.

  • Diamond Shopping (Solo)
    • A pretty easy mission that requires the player to kill some guards inside a jewelry store, steal a briefcase, and then deliver it to a set location.

  • Collector's Pieces (Co-op)
    • Raid three vans on the map, steal cash from them, and deliver the cash.

  • Deal Breaker (Co-op)
    • Take Terrorbyte to the location of an illegal deal and find the pinpoint by checking signals. Raid the deal and steal the cargo, then deliver it.

The cooldown time for solo missions is 30 minutes each, while co-op missions have a cooldown of 10 minutes. However, you are strongly suggested to stay away from co-op missions, as the rewards are split between players, and you end up with something around $10K in the end, while solo missions pay around $30K.

item.title: GTA Online: How To Start/Unlock Mobile Operations Missions
item.description:
The best thing about Grand Theft Auto Online is that there are plenty of missions available to complete and earn some cash, thanks to years of content support, and as the player grows their business, more opportunities become available to earn money and RP in the game, especially when they are featured in weekly double rewards.

Mobile Operations is one of those opportunities that become available to the player after making some progress in the game. While providing access to a variety of exclusive missions, this mobile base can also offer some other valuable services, from a living quarter to vehicle and weapon customization.

How To Get A Mobile Operations Center (MOC)

The first and most important requirement for owning a Mobile Operations Center is a bunker . If you started your Grand Theft Auto Online adventure as a Gunrunner, then you already own one, but if not, visit Maze Bank Foreclosures and buy a bunker first.

Now, the truck is unlocked. Head to Warstock Cache & Carry , and you will find MOC next to Terrorbyte. The base version of the truck without any upgrades costs $1,225,000 . Now, if you want an armored hauler to carry the trailer, the price bumps up to $1,400,000.

In order to play the Mobile Operations missions, you don't need to get any of the Bay upgrades , so choose them at your own will.

How To Unlock Mobile Operations Missions

After buying the truck, it will be parked inside your bunker. If you head inside the trailer, there will be a monitor on the wall , which provides access to Mobile Operations missions , but you may notice that they are all locked.

Unfortunately, owning the truck itself is not enough to play Mobile Operations missions. Unlocking these missions requires the player to steal supplies for their gunrunning business.

So, head to the laptop inside the bunker and go to the resupply menu. Now, click on Steal Supply and complete the mission. Every time you complete 2 Steal Supply quests, one of the Mobile Operations Missions will be unlocked. So, a total of 14 supply runs are needed to unlock almost all missions . The final mission actually has a secondary lock, which breaks when you complete all the other Mobile Operations missions.

Thankfully, there are no more requirements from here on. Aside from the fact that Mobile Operations missions pay decently, they also unlock the Trade Price for the vehicles they represent. So, it's a win-win deal to complete these missions as soon as possible if you plan to buy a military vehicle anytime soon.

Last but not least, all Mobile Operations missions are co-op . So, if you're looking for some solo activities, MOC is not the way to go. That being said, the missions still pay well, though they usually take around 10 to 20 minutes to complete, and they are action-heavy.

item.title: 8 Best Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered Mods
item.description:
Summary

  • The modding community enhances Oblivion Remastered with performance tweaks, visual improvements, and new features.
  • Ayleid Reshade mod restores vibrant colors and lighting for players nostalgic for the original game.
  • Achievements Enabler mod allows players to keep achievement functionality, preserving engagement beyond main objectives.

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has brought a beloved classic back into the spotlight, revitalizing the iconic RPG with upgraded visuals, refined mechanics, and a smoother overall experience. But while the remaster offers a fresh coat of paint, it's the passionate modding community that truly unlocks its full potential. Despite the lack of official mod support, fans wasted no time diving in and creating enhancements that range from visual overhauls and quality-of-life improvements to immersive gameplay tweaks and nostalgic throwbacks.

Whether players are returning veterans looking to recapture the magic of the original or a new adventurer stepping into Cyrodiil for the first time, mods can tailor Oblivion Remastered to suit any playstyle. From restoring classic lighting to improving performance and adding new features, these community creations keep the game evolving.

1 Ultimate Engine

Get Rid Of Glitches

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: P40L0X

Despite only being released this month, it is important to remember that it is a remaster of a very old game and can still be prone to glitches or problems early on. This mod addresses many of the performance issues players might encounter by reducing stutters, input lag, and removing visual effects like film grain and chromatic aberration.

If a player finds themselves having trouble traversing the scenic landscapes of Cyrodiil (or they just want a smoother gameplay experience), this mod could be helpful in their journey.

2 Ayleid Reshade

Bright And Beautiful

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: Logriff

Unfortunately, some players of the original Elder Scrolls game have been disappointed with how the remaster looks in terms of color, reporting it to be muted in tone when compared to the original.

The Ayleid Reshade mod restores the vibrant colors and lighting of the original Oblivion without sacrificing the clear and modern graphics of its remaster. If a player misses the way Cyrodiil used to look, or they appreciate a more vibrant color palette, this mod is for them.

3 Achievement Enabler

No Missing Out

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: shad0wshayd3

Achievements in video games offer players a sense of progression, challenge, and accomplishment beyond the main objectives that the game offers. They often reward exploration, skillful play, or creative problem-solving, adding extra layers of engagement to a game.

For players who use the console commands and disable achievements, this mod restores and preserves that functionality, removes the no-achievement flag, as well as warnings. With this mod, there is no missing out on the achievement buzz.

4 Pre-Exit Sewers Save

A Fresh Start

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: mskone

This is a convenient mod that places players right before leaving the Imperial Sewers, allowing full customization of their character without having to replay the lengthy tutorial. The save file still gives players full control over race, class, birthsign, and appearance, just before stepping into the wider world of Cyrodiil.

This mod is perfect for players who have been through the tutorial many times and want to jump straight into the adventure, or those who just can't wait to get started. Whether testing mods or starting a new roleplay, it offers a clean slate and a convenient head start without cutting corners on character setup.

5 Starter Camp

Rest Up

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: Haphestia

This mod for Oblivion provides players with a small campsite just outside the Imperial City Sewers, perfect for beginning a new adventure. Equipped with basic supplies like a bedroll, campfire, and storage containers, it gives a lore-friendly and practical starting point.

Ideal for players who collected all the loot they could in the sewers (and are now over-encumbered) or those who want to plan their journey, the Starter Camp helps ease gamers into the world of Cyrodiil. The quaint little camp adds a grounded touch to the early-game experience while keeping immersion and balance intact.

6 Horse Whistle

Summon And Follow

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: PushTheWinButton

A small yet incredibly convenient addition for players who frequently use horseback travel but find that losing track of their horse or leaving it behind can be extremely easy, especially when exploring vast distances. This mod adds a simple whistle item that, when used, instantly calls your horse to your location.

This saves time, frustration, and more importantly, gold. Both immersive and practical, the whistle is a must-have for players who enjoy riding across Cyrodiil without the hassle of constantly searching for their steed.

7 One Ring Or Maybe Two

Or Maybe Two

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: Puff3r

If a player intends to build skills and max out their character quickly, this mod adds two rings and an amulet to help with just that. While a lot of players like to keep RPGs as realistic as possible, some prefer to start on top, and with these rings comes the opportunity to tip the scales in their favor, improving strength, intelligence, and willpower, to name a few.

The One Ring or Maybe Two mod opens up new possibilities for character builds, especially magic-focused or stealth-based characters who benefit from stacking enchantments. It also adds a humorous twist to the game’s realism.

8 Killed NPCs Don't Drop Their Weapons

No Searching Required

  • Mod Link
  • Mod Creator: shimmernexus

The Killed NPCs Don’t Drop Their Weapons mod for the Oblivion Remastered prevents enemies from automatically dropping their weapons upon death. In the vanilla game, looting weapons from every fallen NPC can quickly become frustrating, as the weapons used by the NPC will not be in their inventory and therefore are easily lost.

Since looting enemies for their items is a surefire way to earn gold for any adventurer, wasting time searching in the grass for a bow or sword to sell isn't helpful in the slightest. Players using this mod will be delighted to see that searching a dead NPC is more akin to Skyrim , saving them precious time and gold.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Might Be Bethesda’s Most Honest Game Yet
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered stays true to the original game's quirks, bugs, and jank.
  • The game is a remaster, not a remake, focusing mainly on visual improvements.
  • Oblivion Remastered's Deluxe Edition even includes the infamous Horse Armor DLC, showing commitment to the original game's charm.

It's finally here. After countless leaks and rumors, The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has finally shown itself, and it has been off to a very strong start since its surprise launch. For longtime veterans, Oblivion Remastered is a trip down memory lane with a fresh look, and for newcomers, it's a chance to experience one of the most defining Elder Scrolls games in style. While it does have a lot of style, however, it still keeps a lot of the substance of the original game intact.

For all intents and purposes, The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered might be Bethesda's most honest game yet. Rather than attempting to convince its audience that Oblivion Remastered is something that it isn't, both its showcase of the game and the game itself are proof that Bethesda doesn't want that at all. Instead, it knows its fans wanted Oblivion , so it gave them Oblivion — and it's better for that.

Oblivion Remastered Shows Bethesda's Commitment to Its History

Oblivion Remastered Overhauls the Visuals But Embraces the Original's Quirks

Ahead of Oblivion Remastered 's release, one of the biggest questions about the rumored Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion remake was whether it would or should retain the quirks, bugs, and jank of the original game. After all, that is a significant part of not only what makes Oblivion what it is, but also what gives an Elder Scrolls game its personality. Now that Oblivion Remastered has launched, that conversation has continued, except that it has somewhat shifted inside the looming shadow of the much larger debate about whether Oblivion Remastered is a remaster or a remake.

Well, technically, Oblivion Remastered really is just a remaster, despite all the gameplay improvements it introduces. For a game to be a true remake, it needs to be built from the ground up, potentially with new assets, a new direction, and revamped mechanics. A great example of a true remake is Final Fantasy 7 Remake , which still maintains the core story and gameplay principles of the original game but builds on top of them something entirely brand-new. The primary thing that Oblivion Remastered has changed is its visuals, though, again, its gameplay has improved in some ways.

Oblivion Remastered has made improvements to the original game's third-person mode, its leveling system, its sneak and stealth system, and much more.

What this has ultimately resulted in is Oblivion Remastered 's Cyrodiil embracing the quirks of the original game rather than disposing of them or trying to cover them up. In a way, this is Bethesda being honest about what Oblivion was and still is, especially in light of the fact that it chose to call it a remaster rather than a remake.

Oblivion Remastered Even Includes the Original's Horse Armor DLC

Oblivion Remastered has even gone so far as to offer the infamous Horse Armor DLC, which was not only one of the first major microtransactions for a single-player game, but also one of the best-selling DLC packs for the original Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion . However, in an age of gaming when microtransactions are largely looked down upon, simple Horse Armor DLC might be a tough sell. Nevertheless, it shows Bethesda's commitment to double down on the original Oblivion 's charm, even that which extended beyond the game itself.

In a way, this is Bethesda being honest about what Oblivion was and still is, especially in light of the fact that it chose to call it a remaster rather than a remake.

Oblivion Remastered isn't trying to be flawless, and that's what makes it so unique as a Bethesda game. The developer had an opportunity here to significantly improve the gameplay of a game that is nearly twenty years old, and instead it chose to let Oblivion continue to be Oblivion in the remaster, only with the fresh coat of paint it has long needed. Oblivion Remastered embraces the flaws of the original, showing Bethesda isn't afraid of the quirks found in its games, instead of trying to convince its fanbase that its new game is polished to perfection.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Cookie Run: Kingdom Code Gets You Gold Button Coupon
item.description:
Summary

  • Cookie Run: Kingdom players can use code KINGDOM1MILLION to receive 3,000 Crystals and 1,500 Rainbow Cubes.
  • Crystals unlock new Cookies in the game's gacha, while Rainbow Cubes can unlock in-game costumes.
  • The code commemorates Cookie Run's YouTube channel reaching one million subscribers and is available to redeem until May 31.

The developers of Cookie Run: Kingdom have recently unveiled a new code to commemorate the game’s YouTube channel reaching one million subscribers and obtaining the Gold Button award. This new Cookie Run: Kingdom code is an excellent opportunity for gamers to acquire free goodies to spend on the gacha and try to gain access to new cookies and items.

Cookie Run: Kingdom is a popular free-to-play gacha game originally released in 2021. The title is an endless runner role-playing game with kingdom-building mechanics, and it has been growing in popularity in recent years.

Now, developer Devsisters is giving players the chance to obtain new items by using the KINGDOM1MILLION code on Cookie Run: Kingdom . The new code will give gamers access to 3,000 Crystals and 1,500 Rainbow Cubes. To activate it, players can either visit the Coupons section in-game or access the official Cookie Run: Kingdom website and use the coupon and PlayerID. The code was shared as a commemoration because the game’s channel reached a million subscribers, and it can be redeemed until May 31. After the code is redeemed, players will be free to keep the items for as long as they want, but it’s important to get them soon while the code is still active.

Cookie Run: Kingdom Gold Button Coupon Code

  • Code: KINGDOM1MILLION
  • Rewards: Crystals x3,000, Rainbow Cubes x1,500

Gamers who have gained these items can use them in Cookie Run: Kingdom ’s gacha. Crystals can be used to unlock more Cookies in Cookie Run: Kingdom , for example, which already has 156 playable characters. Rainbow Cubes, however, are used by gamers who want to get alternative costumes for their Cookies, and are pretty useful for anyone looking to get access to improved customization of their favorite characters.

This is not the only code unveiled in April for Cookie Run: Kingdom , though. A few days ago, Devsisters unveiled a code that gave players 3,000 Crystals, 3,000 Rainbow Cubes, and 3,000 Choco Chalk, a rather generous collection of rewards.

April has been a fairly eventful month for the Cookie Run: Kingdom community. Apart from these codes, the game saw a new update, The Flame Awakens. The new Cookie Run: Kingdom update brought two Legendary Cookies to the game, Fire Spirit Cookie and Agar Agar Cookie, as well as two new costumes and more. It’s expected that the developers will continue to add more Cookies through 2005, giving the community even more reason to continue playing the popular F2P title and engaging with its systems.
